result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah J Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
* The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: CONCURRENT TO case 16CF1731, with credit for ONE HUNDRED TWENTY-THREE (123) DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes: * Obtain and maintain employment or school.

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah J Moore

records.addlTxt: On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

AS TO COUNT 3:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THREE AND ONE HALF (3.5) YEARS CONCURRENT TO case 16CF1731, with credit for ONE HUNDRED TWENTY-THREE (123) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is EIGHTEEN (18) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWO (2) YEARS.  The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.
* Obtain and maintain employment or school.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs, surcharges and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections in an amount deemed reasonable from wages and from other monies held in in the defendants inmate account under Sec. 973.02(11)(c) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Defendant Isaiah J Moore in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Isaiah J Moore in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Hearing proceeded on the Record.  State RENEWED their motion to REVOKE.  Defense and Defendant conceded that there is a factual basis for the REVOCATION.  The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance and State's motion, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Br. 33.  DEFENDANT IS REMANDED PENDING THE NEXT DATE.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Per Defense,  matter is RESCHEDULED to 10-20-2016 at 09:30 am for Review.  sdg

Signature bond reinstated.

TURNOVER TO JUSTICEPOINT FOR PLACEMENT.  UPON PLACEMENT BAIL TO REVERT TO $500.00 PR BOND.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Isaiah J Moore in court with attorney Meighan Martha Anger.  Defendant Isaiah J Moore in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.

The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements/Jury Instructions/Ineligible Voting Notice received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 23, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Defendant has been accepted into DTC/DPA.  Matter scheduled for further Proceedings on 06-15-2016 at 02:30 pm.  sdg

Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court amends bail to $750.00 cash bond. Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Case is called on the record at approximately 9:50 a.m.
The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with #1 Sports at 3429 W. North Ave

Defendant Isaiah J Moore in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Isaiah J Moore in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
